alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Dallas; Elmore; Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 9:11PM CDT until March 30 at 12:10PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River At Montgomery affecting Autauga, Elmore, Dallas, Montgomery and Lowndes Counties. Alabama River At R.F. Henry Lock and Dam affecting Dallas, Lowndes and Autauga Counties. Alabama River At Selma affecting Dallas County. .Flooding continues on the Alabama River and a flood warning remains in effect. The Alabama River at Selma is forecast to crest just below moderate flood stage. Another statement will be issued by Tuesday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alabama River At Montgomery. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Some flooding of low lying areas and secondary roads begins in the Montgomery area. Flooding of the golf course at Maxwell Air Force Base and portions of River Road occurs at stages around 30 feet and higher. At 35.0 feet, Extensive flooding of low lands in the area occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 35.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Monday was 35.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 42.4 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
